result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce M. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with assessment deemed appropriate by the Dept. and follow through with any recommendations.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it and must report it to agent within 24 hours.  AODA and domestic violence assessments.  Provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Bruce M. Johnson.  Attorney Emily Eklund in court for State of Wisconsin.  Both counsel received the PSI and have no corrections.  Victim notification has been met in all cases.  State makes recommendation of prison.  Atty Masana makes recommendation of following the PSI.  Jail credit will be addressed by Stipulation.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:

WI State Prison for 3 years (1 year Initial Confinement/2 years Extended Supervision), consecutive to all others  
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Submit to DNA Sample

CONDITIONS OF ES:

Comply with assessment deemed appropriate by the Dept. and follow through with any recommendations
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it and must report it to agent within 24 hours
AODA and domestic violence assessments
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Bruce M. Johnson.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes 21CF695 and 21CF700 haven't had prelims yet.  State notes VIS filed in 21CF758 only but all files the victim's have been noticed.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver in 21CF695 and 21CF700/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Masana acknowledges rec. informations, waives reading and stands mute.  Court reviews charges/max penalties in informations in 21CF695 and 21CF700 with the DE and enters NG pleas.  Court notes cases are in posture for plea agreement and notes she rec'd a CSR.  Pleas to be entered today w/request for PSI and argued sentencing.  Court notes the plea agreement as she understands it per the CSR.  21FO841 not to be addressed today but State will reach out to City Atty.  Court notes that matter was closed previously w/a default so it will remain as such.  Court questions DE on the pleas he wishes to enter.  DE pleads NC to agreed counts.  Court questions DE on his pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court orders PSI on all charges where DE plead NC.  Court orders bonds revoked in all case pending sentencing.  PSI to be returned to the Court w/in 75 days and upon receipt a SEH will be set.  Court admonishes DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

21CM359 - Dismissed/read-in
21CM507 - Ct 2:  NC
21CM508 - Ct 1:  NC
21CF426 - Ct 1:  NC
21CF646 - Dismissed/read-in
21CF695 - Ct 1:  NC
21CF700 - Dismissed/read-in
21CF758 - Ct 2:  NC
22CF107 - Ct 1:  NC
22CF108 - Ct 1 and Ct 4:  NC
22CF109 - Ct 3:  NC

All other counts are dismissed/read-in

11:20 AM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Bruce M. Johnson. Atty Masana received a copy of the Information.  Atty Masana stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, Matter is set for plea and sentencing.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 19, 2022 at 08:00 am.

11:09 AM Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in custody.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Masana states DE will waive his right to prelim in all three cases.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waivers/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over in all three cases.  Atty Masana requests ARGN be set out noting DE is being transferred to Mendota tomorrow and they'd like to address that prior to proceeding w/arraignment.  Atty Masana to get a date of some kind from Br 3.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.

02:34 PM Defendant Bruce M. Johnson in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes .  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bruce M. Johnson appeared by video means.    Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE qualifies for PD representation. State requests $1000 Cash bond.   Atty. Hayes makes argument and competency.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contct w/K.J.D., S.M.D. or Thunderbird Motor Inn.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.
